channel.title: Posts on Uncertainty...Minimized
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Uncertainty...Minimized

item.title: Statistically Verifying Claims Made in Childrens Stories
item.author: mj514316@domain.com (Michael C Johnson)
item.description: Bedtime has historically been a battle for our family. Kids have this impressive ability to fall asleep when you want them awake and vigorously stay away when you want them to sleep. To combat the insanity, we read a few books every night before bed. There is a great series of books for young children called “The Magic Tree House”. The premise of the whole series two children (Jack and Annie) who transport to other times and places for some mystery or adventure.

item.title: How Many Boys is Too Many?
item.author: mj514316@domain.com (Michael C Johnson)
item.description: Anyone who has multiple boys in a row at some point asks themselves a question: did I just get ‘lucky’ or are we only able to have boys? As you can see, we certainly asked that question… When we had our third boy in a row I started to wonder: how many children do you have to have of a given sex before you can statistically conclude that there is something other than random chance influencing to the outcome?

item.title: Deep Autoencoder Neural Networks for Maximal Christmas Decoration Enjoyment
item.author: mj514316@domain.com (Michael C Johnson)
item.description: My wife loves decorations. From Valentines Day to Easter to Thanksgiving, our house is adorned with interesting festive items. Her favorite season by far is Christmas. Every December we drive around trying to find the best Christmas lights. Inevitably, there are a few houses with lights that blink with the music, something I’ve always been fascinated with. Two years ago I embarked on a mission to build my own Christmas Light Show, specifically this is what I had in mind:
